intro: Pernettya racemulosa, commonly known as the clustered cranberry bush, is a deciduous shrub native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like blueberries and azaleas. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in early spring. Its berries, which are edible, are usually red or black and have a tart flavor. Pernettya racemulosa thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, forested areas.
